I created a folder called "External" and then created a linked folder using the Package Explorer and clicked OK. The folder I'm linking to has 1158 files in 149 folders. The Create folder dialog didn't go away right away, it had a status line that said "Creating Refreshing". The Package Explorer started flashing like crazy. When I tried to expand the new directory I got a strange little box that wouldn't go away near the bottom of my screen (I'll attach a screenshot).

Hmm, I just noticed that my Progress window shows a ton of lines that say:

Fetching children of Problems (Cancelled)

some of them have green progress bars and these words underneath:

Refreshing view: Refreshing marker counts

Created an attachment (id=31966)
This little box was opened by Eclipse when I tried to expand the folder.

I think the box might have been a failed attempt to show an animation for an error dialog, because after restarting Eclipse I kept getting these errors:

Updating Change Sets for CVS Workspace
An internal error occurred during: "Updating Change Sets for CVS Workspace".

At the time I got this particular error I was trying to do a Team > Switch to another branch or version.

The Error log shows:

Error 2005-12-19 13:04:20.228 An internal error occurred during: "Updating Change Sets for CVS Workspace".

I'm using Mylar 0.4.6.1 but all the Mylar filters are turned off. Adding Mik because I saw Mylar in this traceback.

The Mylar stack trace is a duplicate of bug 121448 (didn't yet have time to check if this entire report is so I didn't mark it as such).  The work-around for htis is to disable the change set management via the Mylar->Team prefs page.

I just noticed this bug, and it looks like a problem in the marker view... moving to Tod.  Tod, see the initial comment about hundreds of worker threads doing marker view updates.  If you look at the stack trace with the Out of memory error you can see where the jobs are created:

This issue is pretty old now - I did a lot of optimization to the marker update story since then. We were much more aggressive before.

Fetching children of Problems and Refreshing view: Refreshing marker counts were seperate jobs before and are not now. However we never created a ton of jobs so I am not sure it is the jobs we have or someone firing a ton of selection updates to the selection service.

"Creating Refreshing" is not one of our jobs.

Ed have you seen anything like this since? We'll leave this open as there seem to be a lot of potential places to keep an eye on.
I haven't seen it in a while. Feel free to mark it as WORKSFORME or something like that.
